trial_identification.studytitle: Dietary Intake of Micronutrients During Pregnancy and Breastfeeding
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Micronutrient intake and status in pregnant and breastfeeding women

conditions.healthcondition: Iodine deficiency during pregnancy and lactation
Selenium deficiency during pregnancy and lactation

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: Iodine and selenium intake and status estimated in pregnant and breastfeeding women in NZ. Participants will supply one sample of urine collected over 24 hours. Breastfeeding women will also supply one sample of breastmilk. Recruitment will last 6 months.
interventions.comparator: Iodine and selenium intakes in pregnant and breastfeeding women in previous NZ studies from 1990-2009 reported in journal articles.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Iodine and selenium concentrations measured in a 24 hour urine sample. Each participant will collect all the urine excreted over one 24 hour period.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Pregnant women of gestational age greater than 26 weeks and lactating women at least 3 weeks postpartum

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Iodine and selenium concentrations measured in breast milk
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Lactating women at least 3 weeks postpartum. Each participant will provide 1 sample of breastmilk (around 30 ml).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Dietary intake of other nutrients assessed using three 24 hour diet histories and dietary assessment computer package (Foodworks 2009)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Pregnant women of gestational age greater than 26 weeks and lactating women at least 3 weeks postpartum. 24 hour diet recalls will be collected at the first interview and then 2 further consecutive weeks.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy pregnant women > 26 weeks gestational age Healthy breastfeeding women > 3 weeks postpartum
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: No medical complications No complications during pregnancy or lactation No medications containing iodine or selenium

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Massey University Manawatu Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442 New Zealand

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Massey University Manawatu Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442 New Zealand

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Massey University Manawatu Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442 New Zealand

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Iodine and selenium intakes are known to be low in New Zealand. The study will investigate current iodine and selenium intakes in a North Island population of pregnant and breastfeeding women.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Massey University Ethics Committee Southern A
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Massey University Manawatu Private Bag 11 222 Palmerston North 4442
